intro: Draba mawii, commonly known as the Mawis alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Draba mawii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in high-altitude ecosystems.
